title: Form-filling guidance app with contact info and work-from-home learning content

requirements.text: Create the core app navigation and pages for: (1) Guided Form Filling, (2) Contact & Support, and (3) Learn (make money online from home), with all user-facing text in English.

quotes: For form filling people we guide and contact information and learn how to make money online from home

acceptanceCriteria: App has clearly labeled navigation to the three sections (Guided Form Filling, Contact & Support, Learn).
Each section renders a dedicated page/route with English headings and copy.
Pages are responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Implement a guided form-filling flow that helps users complete common online forms step-by-step, including: selecting a form type, showing required fields, providing tips/examples per field, and producing a final review screen before submission (no actual submission to third-party sites).

quotes: For form filling people we guide

acceptanceCriteria: User can choose from at least 3 form types (e.g., job application, survey, registration) and see a step-by-step wizard.
Each step displays field guidance (tips/examples) and basic validation (required fields, simple formats like email/phone).
A final review screen summarizes entered data and guidance reminders; the flow clearly states the user must submit on the external site themselves.

requirements.text: Provide a Contact & Support section that shows support contact information and a help request form (name, email, message) that stores requests in the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact page displays at least: support email, hours/availability text, and a short support note in English.
Help request form validates required fields and email format on the client.
On submit, a backend call persists the help request and the UI shows a success state.
A backend query endpoint exists to list submitted help requests (for future admin use).

requirements.text: Create a Learn section with structured educational content about making money online from home (articles/lessons), including categories, lesson detail pages, and clear disclaimers about avoiding scams and not guaranteeing income.

quotes: learn how to make money online from home

acceptanceCriteria: Learn page lists lessons grouped by category (e.g., freelancing basics, online surveys, content creation, remote customer support).
User can open a lesson detail view that shows title, reading time (or length indicator), and the lesson body in English.
UI prominently displays a disclaimer that results are not guaranteed and includes a short “scam awareness” checklist.
Lessons are served from the backend via query endpoints (not hardcoded only in the UI).

requirements.text: Implement Motoko backend data models and endpoints to support: (a) fetching form guidance templates, (b) fetching learning lessons and categories, and (c) creating and listing help requests. Persist this data in canister stable state.

quotes: For form filling people we guide and contact information and learn how to make money online from home

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods to fetch form guidance templates and learning lessons/categories.
Backend exposes an update method to create a help request and persists it.
Backend exposes a query method to list help requests.
Data persists across canister upgrades using stable variables (no migration file unless actually required by implementation).

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for an educational/support experience; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.
acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a consistent theme (e.g., warm neutral background with green/orange accents) across all pages.
Typography and spacing are consistent; primary/secondary button styles are unified.
No blue/purple is used as the primary brand color.

requirements.text: Add generated static brand/illustration assets and use them in the UI (stored under frontend/public/assets/generated), including a simple logo and a hero illustration.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in imageRequirements.required.
Header/nav displays the generated logo.
Home/landing area (or top of Learn page) displays the generated hero illustration.
Images are loaded as static assets from the frontend (not fetched via backend).

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other immutablePaths; compose those components instead.
nonGoals: Integrating third-party form submission or scraping external form websites.
Guaranteeing earnings or providing financial/legal advice.
Third-party authentication providers (use Internet Identity only if authentication becomes necessary later).

required: Minimal flat logo mark of a clipboard with a checkmark and a small house icon, warm neutral + green accent (app-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero illustration of a person working at home on a laptop with simple UI form elements floating nearby, warm neutral background with green/orange accents (hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png)
